    • Method Detail

      • createPurchaseItem

        public WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> createPurchaseItem(Long accountId,
                                                       String appKey,
                                                       String name,
                                                       String description,
                                                       Integer tickets,
                                                       Float price,
                                                       Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType,
                                                       String purchaseCode,
                                                       String secretKey,
                                                       Integer purchaseLimit,
                                                       Enums.ServiceAction serviceAction,
                                                       Long coverAssetId,
                                                       Long promoAssetId,
                                                       Boolean giftable,
                                                       Boolean assetable)
                                                         throws SirqulException
        Creates a purchase item for in app purchases.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/create
        Parameters:
        accountId - The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        appKey - The application key that the purchase can be used in
        name - The name of the purchase item
        description - The description of the purchase item
        tickets - How much the purchase item is worth in tickets
        price - How much the purchase item will cost in real money
        purchaseType - The purchase provider
        • SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets
        • IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
        • GOOGLE - the Google Play store
        • AMAZON - the Amazon Android store
        • MAC - the iTunes store for OSX
        • WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store
        • FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes)
        purchaseCode - The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases
        secretKey - A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation
        purchaseLimit - How many times a user acquire the same purchase item
        serviceAction - Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features
        • DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership
        • WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership
        • MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership
        • ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account
        • ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift
        coverAssetId - The cover image of the purchase item
        promoAssetId - An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data
        giftable - Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users
        assetable - Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item
        Returns:
        WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • deletePurchaseItem

        public SirqulResponse deletePurchaseItem(Long accountId,
                                Long purchaseItemId)
                                  throws SirqulException
        Marks the purchase item as deleted.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/delete
        Parameters:
        accountId - The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        purchaseItemId - The purchase item id
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

        public WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> getPurchaseItem(Long accountId,
                                                    Long purchaseItemId)
                                                      throws SirqulException

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/get
        Parameters:

        purchaseItemId - The purchase item id
        Returns:
        WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • searchPurchaseItems

        public SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> searchPurchaseItems(Long accountId,
                                                       String appKey,
                                                       Boolean filterByBillable,
                                                       List<Enums.PurchaseType> purchaseTypes,
                                                       List<Enums.ServiceAction> serviceActions,
                                                       String keyword,
                                                       Enums.PurchaseItemApiMap sortField,
                                                       Boolean descending,
                                                       Integer start,
                                                       Integer limit,
                                                       Boolean activeOnly)
                                                         throws SirqulException
        Search for purchasable items from the system.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/search
        Parameters:
        accountId - The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        appKey - The application key to filter results by application
        filterByBillable - Determines whether to filter results by the user's billable entity
        purchaseTypes - the purchase types
        serviceActions - the service actions
        keyword - The keyword used to search
        sortField - The column to sort the search on. Possible values include: ID, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, ACTIVATED, EXPIRES, TITLE, SUBTITLE, DETAILS, OFFER_TYPE, SPECIAL_OFFER_TYPE, OFFER_VISIBILITY, ESTIMATED_VALUE, VOUCHER_PRICE, RETAILER_ID, RETAILER_NAME, RETAILER_LOCATION_ID, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, BILLABLE_ENTITY_ID, BILLABLE_ENTITY_NAME, RESPONSIBLE_DISPLAY
        descending - The order to return the search results
        start - The record to begin the return set on
        limit - The number of records to return
        activeOnly - Return only active results
        Returns:
        SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • updatePurchaseItem

        public WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> updatePurchaseItem(Long accountId,
                                                       Long purchaseItemId,
                                                       String name,
                                                       String description,
                                                       Integer tickets,
                                                       Float price,
                                                       Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType,
                                                       String purchaseCode,
                                                       String secretKey,
                                                       Integer purchaseLimit,
                                                       Enums.ServiceAction serviceAction,
                                                       Long coverAssetId,
                                                       Long promoAssetId,
                                                       Boolean giftable,
                                                       Boolean assetable,
                                                       Boolean active)
                                                         throws SirqulException
        Updates a purchase item for in app purchases.

        Target API Endpoint: /purchase/update
        Parameters:
        accountId - The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        purchaseItemId - The purchase item id
        name - The name of the purchase item
        description - The description of the purchase item
        tickets - How much the purchase item is worth in tickets
        price - How much the purchase item will cost in real money
        purchaseType - The purchase provider
        • SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets
        • IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch
        • GOOGLE - the Google Play store
        • AMAZON - the Amazon Android store
        • MAC - the iTunes store for OSX
        • WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store
        • FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes)
        purchaseCode - The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases
        secretKey - A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation
        purchaseLimit - How many times a user acquire the same purchase item
        serviceAction - Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features
        • DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership
        • WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership
        • MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership
        • ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account
        • ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift
        coverAssetId - The cover image of the purchase item
        promoAssetId - An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data
        giftable - Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users
        assetable - Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item
        active - Sets whether the purchase item is active or inactive (hidden from consumers)
        Returns:
        WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
